name: LambdaInvokeFunction
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown:
Please refer to [AWS Lambda Developer Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/) for more information on working with AWS Lambda.

More information on this task can be found in the [task reference](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vsts/latest/userguide/lambda-invoke.html).

####Task Permissions
This task requires permissions to call the following AWS service APIs (depending on selected task options, not all APIs may be used):
* lambda:GetFunctionConfiguration
* lambda:InvokeFunction

inputs.name: regionName
inputs.label: AWS Region TODO remove this one
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The AWS region code (us-east-1, us-west-2 etc) of the region containing the AWS resource(s) the task will use or create. For more information see [AWS Regions and Endpoints](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

If a region is not explicitly configured the task will attempt to obtain the region to be used from the following sources:

* From a task variable named _AWS.Region_.
* From the standard AWS environment variable _AWS_REGION_ in the build agent's environment.
*  If the build agent is running on an Amazon EC2 instance, from instance metadata associated with the EC2 instance.

__Note:__ The regions listed in the picker are those known at the time this software was released. New regions that are not listed may still be used by entering the _region code_ of the region (for example _us_west_2_).

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: Function Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Lambda function to invoke. You can also specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function.

inputs.name: payload
inputs.label: Payload
inputs.helpMarkDown: The payload to pass to the function. The payload must be JSON.

options.RequestResponse: Synchronous execution, returning the output from the function.

inputs.name: outputVariable
inputs.label: Output Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the variable that will contain the function output on task completion. The variable can be used as $(variableName) to refer to the function result in subsequent tasks.

inputs.name: logType
inputs.label: Log Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: For synchronous execution, returns the base64-encoded last 4 KB of log data produced by your Lambda function in the x-amz-log-result header.

messages.SettingOutputVariable: Setting output variable %s with the function output
